title: Traditional Chinese Medicine: A 2-part Series - Rutgers School of Nursing

cleaned_text: October 16 and 23, 2019 1pm - 4pm Registration & Fees - Regular: $25 - RU faculty, staff, alumni: $15 - Rutgers School of Nursing Current Students : $10 - View the [Registration & Refund Policies](https://nursing.rutgers.edu/ce/policies/) Description October 16 Part 1: Introduction to Traditional Chinese Medicine - Introduction to Traditional Chinese Medicine - Summary of Health maintenance in Traditional Chinese Medicine - Basic knowledge of Traditional Chinese Medicine: The theory of zangxiang and meridian - Conversation—Clinical practice of suitable Technology in Traditional Chinese Medicine October 23 Part 2: Basic Knowledge of Scraping Therapy Massage Techniques: - to prevent colds - techniques to promote intelligence - pediatric massage Location & Map Stanley S. Bergen Building, Room 620B 65 Bergen Street Newark, NJ [View Maps ](https://nursing.rutgers.edu/contact-and-directions/) Questions? [cpdn@rutgers.edu](mailto:cpdn@rutgers.edu) 973-972-6655 [View more continuing education courses](https://nursing.rutgers.edu/ce/course-calendar/) In support of improving patient care, Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences is jointly accredited by the Accreditation Council for Continuing Medical Education (ACCME), the Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE), and the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC), to provide continuing education for the healthcare team.
